funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp

Class WaveManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.WaveManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class WaveManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class that manages a WaveInputStream to acquire (optionally) overlapping and windowed frames of audio and pass them to a chain of processors.

    A WaveFrameListener is used to send completed (processed) frames to anything that needs to listen for these events. Useful for sending processed data back to the main thread.

    See Also:
    WaveFrame, WaveFrameListener

    • Constructor Detail

      • WaveManager

        public WaveManager(WaveInputStream input,
                   int frameLength,
                   int overlap)
        Construct a new WaveManager object from a WaveInputStream with the specified frame length and overlap.
        Parameters:
        input - the WaveInputStream to read audio from
        frameLength - the length of each frame, in samples
        overlap - the length of the overlap of each frame, in samples

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(WaveFrameListener listener)
        Add a WaveFrameListener to the list of listeners

        A WaveFrameListener is used to send completed (processed) frames to anything that needs to listen for these events. Useful for sending processed data back to the main thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - the WaveFrameListener that should listen to events from this object

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(WaveFrameListener listener)
        Remove a WaveFrameListener from the list of listeners
        Parameters:
        listener - the WaveFrameListener to remove (if it exists)

      • addEffectToChain

        public void addEffectToChain(WaveProcessor effect)
        Add a WaveProcessor object to the processing chain
        Parameters:
        effect - the WaveProcessor to add to the end of the chain

      • removeEffectFromChain

        public void removeEffectFromChain(WaveProcessor effect)
        Remove a WaveProcessor object from the processing chain (if it exists in the chain)
        Parameters:
        effect - the WaveProcessor to remove from the chain

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Is this WaveManager currently running?
        Returns:
        true if the WaveManager is running, false otherwise

      • start

        public void start()
        Start processing audio with this WaveManager object

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop processing audio with this WaveManager object

      • run

        public void run()
        Where the actual reading and processing of audio takes place.

        Calling run() directly will begin processing, but this method will block until stop() is called, so it is recommended to place every WaveManager in a dedicated thread, separate from the main thread.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
